content: not accessed or it is not read/write status, run the command: ===> ACCESS LNXADMIN. D (FORCERW DMSACR724I LNX:LNXADMIN. replaces D DMSACR724I (LNX:LNXADMIN.) – If you created directories, access them as well in R/W status: ===> ACCESS LNXADMIN.SWAPGEN E (FORCERW Ready; T=0.01/0.01 16:40:03 ===> ACCESS LNXADMIN.REDHAT F (FORCERW ===> ACCESS LNXADMIN.SUSE G (FORCERW ===> ACCESS LNXADMIN.UBUNTU H (FORCERW 3. On the FTP server. the directory path /ftp/zvm/cookbook/lnxmaint/ (or /ftp/zvm/sg248147/lnxmaint/) was created automatically through the expansion of the .tgz file in 5.2.1, “Creating directories on the FTP server and upload the installation image” on page 108. We are now ready to transfer files from the FTP server to the LNX file pool using one of the following methods: – Perform a get (pull) from z/VM by initiating a session to the FTP server: ===> ftp 9.60.87.87 ... ===> lcd D Chapter 6. Configuring z/VM 245 ===> cd /ftp/zvm/cookbook/lnxmaint ===> mget * ===> quit – Perform a put
